moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6: the Two Knights defense: not really a problem...
moves.4. Ng5 d5 5. exd5 Nxd5: another option, is Na5: but that will fail too, after Bb5+, c6, dxc6, bxc6, Qf3...
moves.6... Kxf7 7. Qf3+: discomforting, to say the least: after Qf6, Bxd5+...
moves.9... Kd7 10. Be6+ Kc6 11. Qf3+ Nd5 12. B: the smoke is clearing: White has won a pawn...
moves.13... Qf6 14. d3 Qxf3 15. gxf3 Rd8 16. c: slowly, but surely, White is taking control over the game...
moves.24... Kd7 25. Ne4 b6 26. b4 h6 27. c5 Nx: unexpected: this pawn has to be stopped...
moves.42... a4 43. Kd4 b3 44. axb3 a3 45. b4 a: pure bluff: the only other move is Ra5...
moves.49. Rxa2: realizing, what he has done, Black resigned: both players had more than six minutes left on the clock...

opening: two knights defence (C57), Fegatello attack, Leonhardt variation
